intro: Tarenna brunnea, commonly known as the brown tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its fruits are small, spherical berries that turn from green to yellow when mature. Tarenna brunnea is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
